section.name: LoggerAppenderSocket
section.p: LoggerAppenderSocket serializes log events and sends them to a network socket.
This appender does not require a layout.

tr.td: Target host. On how to define a remote hostname see fsockopen() documentation.
If set to true the appender will sent the event formatted in XML. Otherwise, the appender will send the event as a serialized PHP object.
Whether location info is included for the XML event format. Ignored if XML format is not used.
In XML format, log4php namespace is used by default. If set to true, log4j namespace will be used instead.

subsection.name: Examples
subsection.p: In this example, log events are sent to localhost:4242, using the serialized format. The host will recieve a serialized LoggerLoggingEvent object.
subsection.pre: <configuration xmlns="http://logging.apache.org/log4php/"> <appender name="default" class="LoggerAppenderSocket"> <param name="remoteHost" value="localhost" /> <param name="port" value="4242" /> </appender> <root> <appender_ref ref="default" /> </root> </configuration>
